content: Ok, I just logged on and the current Headline on ...Military.com... Reads: US Navy Ship Evades Pirate Attack What kind of F`n Navy ship runs from Pirates, especially, a Pirate prison ship ? Attention for the Navy Chief Of Staff: If you ever read this, I`ve gotta say, you are not worthy of your job or Rank cuz you and only you are responsible to maintain a fleet of bravery and honor. When one of your Navy vessels RUNS, from an attack by gun fireing Pirates, it shows cowerdness that other countries will enjoy, and your fleet will suffer the tortures of being labled two bit corwards. You have a responsibility to Americans and your fleet, to acknowlage why the skipper was not allowed to fight back. I pay taxes that support your fleet, so you can tuck your tail and run ?? Who the F` do you think you are ? Ok, so there`s a small chance he`ll get it but I`m sorry...it needs to be said !!

content: While I'm no expert on these matters, I'm sure someone on this board knows how to find out more about this ship. I just blew the image up in photoshop, and it appears to be completely unarmed. All the devices on the deck are cranes and pulleys. Off hand I would leave the decision making to the captain of the ship. He would know better than anyone what his equipement is capable of. As for the dumb remark about Obama, well, what can one expect. Dave

content: quote: Originally posted by OddBall1st: Grachus...who runs an unarmed prison ? I know there's a way to look this ship up and see if it's armed. Why not do that? If it was armed, this was, as you say, a disgraceful act - But I really have a hard time believing that. These pirates are often armed with RPG's and other stuff. If the ship was captured by pirates, and the crew made hostage; what then? "Never bring a knife to a gunfight" is an expression I've never had a problem with. Dave

"Never bring a knife to a gunfight" is an expression I've never had a problem with. Dave

content: quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: Doesn't this thing have some anti-aircraft 20MMs about?? Isn't there an arms locker with at least some old M-1s or M-14s aboard??WTF is wrong with the Navy that it's ships can't take on a boat load of pirateazzholes!! What a bunch of puzzies!! Ok, I found the information... quote: USNS LEWIS AND CLARK is the Navy's first Dry Cargo / Ammunition Ship and the second ship in the Navy to bear the name. General Characteristics: Awarded: October 18, 2001 Keel laid: April 22, 2004 Launched: May 21, 2005 Delivered: June 20, 2006 Builder: National Steel and Shipbuilding Company, San Diego, Calif. Propulsion system: Integrated propulsion and ship service electrical system, with generation at 6.6KV by FM/MAN B&W diesel generators Propellers: one Length: 689 feet (210 meters) Beam: 106 feet (32.31 meters) Draft: 29.5 feet (9 meters) Displacement: approx. 41,000 tons full load Speed: 20 knots Dry Cargo Capacity: 1,388,000 cubic feet Fuel Cargo Capacity: 26,000 barrels Aircraft: two helicopters Armament: none Crew: approx. 125 civilians and 49 US Navy Homeport: East Coast "http://navysite.de/ake/ake1.htm" I would suggest the Captain made the right decision. Dave
quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: Doesn't this thing have some anti-aircraft 20MMs about?? Isn't there an arms locker with at least some old M-1s or M-14s aboard??WTF is wrong with the Navy that it's ships can't take on a boat load of pirateazzholes!! What a bunch of puzzies!!

content: quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: Doesn't this thing have some anti-aircraft 20MMs about?? Isn't there an arms locker with at least some old M-1s or M-14s aboard??WTF is wrong with the Navy that it's ships can't take on a boat load of pirateazzholes!! What a bunch of puzzies!! Ok, I found the information... quote: USNS LEWIS AND CLARK is the Navy's first Dry Cargo / Ammunition Ship and the second ship in the Navy to bear the name. General Characteristics: Awarded: October 18, 2001 Keel laid: April 22, 2004 Launched: May 21, 2005 Delivered: June 20, 2006 Builder: National Steel and Shipbuilding Company, San Diego, Calif. Propulsion system: Integrated propulsion and ship service electrical system, with generation at 6.6KV by FM/MAN B&W diesel generators Propellers: one Length: 689 feet (210 meters) Beam: 106 feet (32.31 meters) Draft: 29.5 feet (9 meters) Displacement: approx. 41,000 tons full load Speed: 20 knots Dry Cargo Capacity: 1,388,000 cubic feet Fuel Cargo Capacity: 26,000 barrels Aircraft: two helicopters Armament: none Crew: approx. 125 civilians and 49 US Navy Homeport: East Coast "http://navysite.de/ake/ake1.htm" I would suggest the Captain made the right decision. Dave
quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: Doesn't this thing have some anti-aircraft 20MMs about?? Isn't there an arms locker with at least some old M-1s or M-14s aboard??WTF is wrong with the Navy that it's ships can't take on a boat load of pirateazzholes!! What a bunch of puzzies!!

content: Seem odd if no weapons at all to me since when I served Coast guard ships where fully armed / small boat stations where armed with m16`s, 45`s and shotguns -- and mind you my last year was when they really start the drug interdiction patrols. And you know dang well a p250 fire pump could sink the pirates boat in a heartbeat and thats just a small portable pump. -- Savage

Most of the crew are civilians, and it would be damned embarrasing if they had to surrender or get blown out of the water. Dave

content: Ok, I just logged on and the current Headline on ...Military.com... Reads: US Navy Ship Evades Pirate Attack What kind of F`n Navy ship runs from Pirates, especially, a Pirate prison ship ? Attention for the Navy Chief Of Staff: If you ever read this, I`ve gotta say, you are not worthy of your job or Rank cuz you and only you are responsible to maintain a fleet of bravery and honor. When one of your Navy vessels RUNS, from an attack by gun fireing Pirates, it shows cowerdness that other countries will enjoy, and your fleet will suffer the tortures of being labled two bit corwards. You have a responsibility to Americans and your fleet, to acknowlage why the skipper was not allowed to fight back. I pay taxes that support your fleet, so you can tuck your tail and run ?? Who the F` do you think you are ? Ok, so there`s a small chance he`ll get it but I`m sorry...it needs to be said !!

content: While I'm no expert on these matters, I'm sure someone on this board knows how to find out more about this ship. I just blew the image up in photoshop, and it appears to be completely unarmed. All the devices on the deck are cranes and pulleys. Off hand I would leave the decision making to the captain of the ship. He would know better than anyone what his equipement is capable of. As for the dumb remark about Obama, well, what can one expect. Dave

content: quote: Originally posted by OddBall1st: Grachus...who runs an unarmed prison ? I know there's a way to look this ship up and see if it's armed. Why not do that? If it was armed, this was, as you say, a disgraceful act - But I really have a hard time believing that. These pirates are often armed with RPG's and other stuff. If the ship was captured by pirates, and the crew made hostage; what then? "Never bring a knife to a gunfight" is an expression I've never had a problem with. Dave
